title: SSH username to putty doesn't include domain when set
author: skewty
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Expected Behavior
if username is set to `john` and domain is set to `acme.local` then putty should receive a username of `john@acme.local`

## Current Behavior
if username is set to `john` and domain is set to `acme.local` then putty receives a username of `john` (domain is ignored)

## Possible Solution
include the domain value if it is not blank

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)
<!--- Provide an unambiguous set...
